results.title: Where I Got My Balls From
results.original_title: Where I Got My Balls From
results.overview: In the fall of 2011, Comedian Joey Coco Diaz went to his network of friends on Facebook and Twitter for donations to help produce a Documentary of where Diaz had come from and the result was this.....Where I got My Balls From! A short film showing Diaz in his hometown of North Bergen, New Jersey and the people that made it home for him after the death of his mother at a young age.  Its not an Academy award winner but its got a lot of heart because its real and you feel it. Director Lee Syatt shows you what makes this unique comedian tick!

results.title: Gold Is Where You Find It
results.original_title: Gold Is Where You Find It
results.overview: A millionaire returns to Ireland and loses his gold nuggets before disappearing and sparking a gold rush.

results.title: Buffy Sainte-Marie: Up Where We Belong
results.original_title: Buffy Sainte-Marie: Up Where We Belong
results.overview: Native American singer-songwriter Buffy Sainte-Marie -- who scored a Best Original Song Oscar for the title track in 1983 -- performs along with Red Bull and Stoney Park, two world-champion powwow singing groups from Alberta, Canada. Tunes include "Up Where We Belong," "Cripple Creek," "Bury My Heart at Wounded Knee," "Indian Cowboy in the Rodeo," "Darling Don't Cry," "Piney Wood Hills" and "Until It's Time for You to Go."

results.title: Blast It Biggs! Where Are You?
results.original_title: Blast It Biggs! Where Are You?
results.overview: Back in January 2015 I had the pleasure of talking to Garrick Hagon aka Biggs about his role in Star Wars.

results.title: Home Is Where The Heart Is
results.original_title: Home Is Where The Heart Is
results.overview: Family - Home Is Where The Heart Is is an original story and contemporary Gospel stage play about the Anderson family and their strength that comes from the love they share for each other and their home.

results.title: Where Have All the Dolphins Gone?
results.original_title: Where Have All the Dolphins Gone?
results.overview: This is the first film to reveal the killing of dolphins during purse seine tuna fishing operations of both the U.S. and foreign fleets in the eastern tropical Pacific Ocean, and a film which, after a national primetime Discovery Channel broadcast led to all three U.S. tuna canneries halting the take of tuna caught by setting nets around dolphins. Hosted by Academy-Award winner George C. Scott, Where Have All the Dolphins Gone? also reveals the lives of these animals, the importance of their social makeup, and the devastation to their societies by this fishing method which killed over 10 million dolphins; over 250,000 in one year alone.

results.title: Where to Sit at the Dinner Table
results.original_title: Where to Sit at the Dinner Table
results.overview: The film presents a speculative exercise about the relation between ecological theories and sociologic, economic and management models. Such reflections are intercalated with tales about the ritual of anthropophagy in Brazil in the early 16th century, whose imaginary defines the film's visuals, be it microfilms of books and etchings, or museological and graphic material on Amerindian socio-cosmologies.

results.title: Love Is Where You Find It 2
results.original_title: Love Is Where You Find It 2
results.overview: Three years ago, Walter and Nadia began what seemed to to be the most unusual relationship. Getting used to the 17 year age difference was a struggle for Walter. A big struggle. All is well, until Walter's niece moves to Atlanta and falls for, Tank, Walter's womanizing, best friend. Everyone decides to keep the romance a secret. But when Walter finds out he finds himself, just being Walter.

results.title: Where No Jedi Has Gone Before
results.original_title: Where No Jedi Has Gone Before
results.overview: A Star Wars fan tries to make a good impression when he meets his girlfriend's Trekkie family for dinner. It's a culture clash of two universes, including between his and her family's ethnic backgrounds (they're Asian, he's not).

results.title: Taiwan, where mountains meet the sea
results.original_title: Taiwan, where mountains meet the sea
results.overview: The film gives a glimpse of Taiwan's natural features, from high steep mountains, to shallow coral reefs. In between you'll find lush green fields, many wild life, but also the diverse way its people live. Because though Taiwan houses some of the world's biggest cities, the mountains running through the middle of the island cut the urbanised west from the more rural east. At the same time, Taiwan has a lot of different aboriginal tribes. Through this you might just come to appreciate Taiwan better than ever before.

results.title: Home Video Commentaries: Not Where You Saw
results.original_title: Home Video Commentaries: Not Where You Saw
results.overview: The Ramsey Brothers view home movies and provide artistic and insightful commentary. "Not Where You Saw" tells the riveting tale of one brother's courageous stand for justice.

results.title: Love Is Where You Find It
results.original_title: Love Is Where You Find It
results.overview: When 43 year-old Walter and 26 year-old Nadia met, he wasn't looking for her, and she wasn't looking for him. Now that they are together, nobody can believe it. At times neither can they. To Walters' friends she's a one-night stand. To Nadia's friends he's a sugar daddy. Both find themselves trying to prove to their friends that their relationship is real. While Walter struggles with the relationship because of the difference in age, Nadia embraces it wholeheartedly. Ultimately they find that they've spent so much time convincing the world that their love is true, they must now convince one another.

results.title: The Pineapple Thief - Where We Stood
results.original_title: The Pineapple Thief - Where We Stood
results.overview: THE PINEAPPLE THIEF'S SPECTACULAR FINAL PERFORMANCE OF THEIR 'YOUR WILDERNESS' TOUR FEATURING GAVIN HARRISON (KING CRIMSON) ON DRUMS  Bringing to close an unforgettable 14-date European Winter tour of their 2016 summer hit album 'Your Wilderness', The Pineapple Thief, led by post-progressive mastermind Bruce Soord and reinforced by Gavin Harrison (King Crimson) on drums with Darran Charles (Godsticks) on guitar, gave the sold-out Islington Assembly Hall in London a truly awe-inspiring gig on 11th February 2017. 'Where We Stood' showcases a tight performance from both band regulars and guests on new tracks from 'Your Wilderness', including "In Exile", "No Man's Land" and "The Final Thing On My Mind", and of the classics from previous albums, "Nothing At Best", "Show A Little Love" and "Simple As That".

results.title: Lake Wörthersee - Where Man and Nature Meet
results.original_title: Lake Wörthersee - Where Man and Nature Meet
results.overview: Lake Wörthersee in the Austrian state of Carinthia is not only one of the most beautiful lakes in Austria, but also, in the truest sense of the phrase an "internationally famous stretch of water".

results.title: Where the Streets Have No Name
results.original_title: Where the Streets Have No Name
results.overview: One man’s journey to help alleviate homelessness in Cairns. A hair raising documentary uncovering what lies beneath this Paradise island.

results.title: Where Have You Gone, Joe DiMaggio?
results.original_title: Where Have You Gone, Joe DiMaggio?
results.overview: Winner of the International Monitor Award for Best Documentary, this portrait celebrates one of the most beloved players in the history of baseball, with commentary from Bob Feller, Reggie Jackson, Pete Rose and Mario Cuomo, among others. Explore Joe DiMaggio's life, including his early days in San Francisco, his experiences as a Yankee, his legendary 56-game hitting streak and his much-publicized marriage to Marilyn Monroe.

results.title: Home is Where You Find It
results.original_title: Home is Where You Find It
results.overview: A sixteen year old AIDS orphan directs a documentary about finding a new family is Maputo, Mozambique.

results.title: holes where eyes did once inhabit
results.original_title: holes where eyes did once inhabit
results.overview: A diptych of "Chapel of the Bells Wedding Chapel Exposure" and "Pyramid Lake Piaute Reservation Exposure."

results.title: Doves - Where We're Calling From
results.original_title: Doves - Where We're Calling From
results.overview: The first full-length DVD release by Manchester band Doves. The DVD consists of nine songs recorded live at the Eden Sessions, Cornwall in July 2002, eight of the band's promotional music videos, and documentaries on Doves and Sub Sub, as well as incidental footage, tour films, and hidden features.

results.title: Death by Design: Where Parallel Worlds Meet
results.original_title: Death by Design: Where Parallel Worlds Meet
results.overview: A guided tour into the invisible world of cells, told through a collage of metaphors. Discusses and portrays the invisible world of cells, how they communicate with each other, work together, reproduce, and die, all to benefit the larger organism of which they are a part. State-of-the-art micro-cinematography is playfully intercut with parallel images from life at the human scale: a hundred lighted violins, imploding skyscrapers, pieces of film on the cutting room floor.
